data.title: Cohasset Dramatic Club
data.meta_description: The 2023 Fall Production is The Drowsy Chaperone! Performances are October 27, 28, 29 and November 3 & 4. See you there!
data.text:
2023 Fall Production – The Drowsy Chaperone

AUDITIONS:

AUGUST 28 and 29 @ 7:00PM

CALLBACKS:

AUGUST 30 @ 7:00PM

COHASSET DRAMATIC CLUB

41 HIGHLAND AVE, COHASSET COMMON

PERFORMANCES:

OCTOBER 27, 28 @ 7:30 PM

OCTOBER 29 @ 2:00 PM

NOVEMBER 3, 4 @ 7:30 PM

“That’s the trouble with life. You’re happy for 5 seconds, then something starts ringing.”

Winner of five Tony Awards, including Best Book and Best Original Score, The Drowsy Chaperone is a loving send-up of the Golden Age musical, featuring one show-stopping song and dance number after another.

With the houselights down, a man in a chair appears on stage and puts on his favorite record: the cast recording of a fictitious 1928 musical. The recording comes to life and The Drowsy Chaperone begins as the man in the chair looks on. Mix in two lovers on the eve of their wedding, a bumbling best man, a desperate theatre producer, a not-so-bright hostess, two gangsters posing as pastry chefs, a misguided Don Juan and an intoxicated chaperone, and you have the ingredients for an evening of madcap delight.

Hailed by New York Magazine as “The Perfect Broadway Musical,” The Drowsy Chaperone is a masterful show, poking fun at all the “types” that characterize the musical theatre genre.

Director Lisa Pratt

Music Director Sarah Troxler

Choreographer Tara Morrison

About

When a die-hard theatre fan plays his favorite cast album, the characters come to life in this hilarious Tony Award-winning musical farce.

Cast List

Man In Chair – Danny Bolton*

Mrs. Tottendale – Erin Friday

Underling – David Friday

Robert Martin – Tony Light

George – Shawn Verrier

Feldzieg – Brendan Smith

Kitty – Madison Pratt

Gangster #1 – Halle Pratt

Gangster #2 – Greg Cimmino

Aldolpho – Ian White

Janet Van De Graaf – Christina Maggio

The Drowsy Chaperone – Maryann Zschau

Trix – Caitlin Conrad

Superintendent – Noel Connolly

Staff/Reporters – Al Buckley, Noel Connolly, Caitlin Conrad, Angela Malony

* The actor appears through the courtesy of Actors’ Equity Association, the Union of Professional Actors and Stage Managers in the United States.
